com.thomsonreuters.upa.codec

Interface EncodeIterator


  • public interface EncodeIterator
    An iterator for encoding the RWF content.

    All RWF encoding requires the use of an EncodeIterator, where a single iterator can manage the full encoding process. For instance, if the application is encoding a message containing a FieldList, the same EncodeIterator can be used to encode the message header information, the FieldList information, each FieldEntry, and the content of each entry (primitive types or container types). Separate iterators can be used as well, depending on the needs of the application. Following the same example, one EncodeIterator can be used to pre-encode an entry's content. This pre-encoded content can then be set on the FieldEntry and encoded using the EncodeIterator that is encoding the FieldList. This encoded field list content can then be set on the Msg and yet another EncodeIterator can be used to encode the message and its pre-encoded payload.

    Before encoding begins, the iterator should be initialized to ready it for the encoding process. Initialization consists of several steps. The clear() method can be used to initialize (or re-initialize for reuse) the EncodeIterator. After clearing, a Buffer with ample memory should be associated with the iterator; this will be the buffer that content is encoded into (if using with the UPA Transport, this is often a buffer obtained from the Channel.getBuffer(int, boolean, com.thomsonreuters.upa.transport.Error) method so it can be immediately written after encoding completes). In addition, RWF version information should be provided to the EncodeIterator so the desired version of RWF is encoded. Encode Iterator Example

    The following code example demonstrates creation of the UPA encode iterator and associating with buffer to encode into: 

    •  //Create EncodeIterator using CodecFactory
 EncodeIterator encIter = CodecFactory.createEncodeIterator()}; 
 
 //Clear iterator 
 clear();
 
 //Associate buffer to decode with the iterator and set RWF version on the iterator 
 if (encIter.setBufferAndRWFVersion(encBuffer, 
                            Codec.majorVersion(), 
                            Codec.minorVersion()) < CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS) 
 { 
      //Handle error appropriately 
      return 0; 
 }
 
 //Do encoding using iterator

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        void clear()
        Clears EncodeIterator, defaults to use current version of RWF. After clearing an iterator, the buffer needs to be set using setBufferAndRWFVersion(Buffer, int, int)
        Note:
        This should be used to achieve the best performance while clearing the iterator

      • setBufferAndRWFVersion

        int setBufferAndRWFVersion(Buffer buffer,
                           int rwfMajorVersion,
                           int rwfMinorVersion)
        Sets the encode iterator's buffer and the desired RWF Version on the iterator. When used for encoding, the iterator will then use that version of the RWF to encode. Use this method when you want to encode into RWF, but use your own transport.
        Parameters:
        buffer - Buffer to use for encoding
        rwfMajorVersion - - this is the major version of the wire format to encode
        rwfMinorVersion - - this is the minor version of the wire format to encode
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS if Buffer is successfully associated with iterator and RWF version is set, CodecReturnCodes.VERSION_NOT_SUPPORTED if version is invalid, CodecReturnCodes.FAILURE if invalid buffer length or buffer data.
        See Also:
        Buffer

      • setBufferAndRWFVersion

        int setBufferAndRWFVersion(TransportBuffer buffer,
                           int rwfMajorVersion,
                           int rwfMinorVersion)
        Sets the encode iterator's buffer and the desired RWF Version on the iterator. When used for encoding, the iterator will then use that version of the RWF to encode. Use this method when you want to encode into RWF and use UPAJ's transport.
        Parameters:
        buffer - TransportBuffer to use for encoding
        rwfMajorVersion - - this is the major version of the wire format to encode
        rwfMinorVersion - - this is the minor version of the wire format to encode
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS if TransportBuffer successfully associated with iterator and RWF version is set, CodecReturnCodes.VERSION_NOT_SUPPORTED if version is invalid, CodecReturnCodes.FAILURE if invalid buffer length or buffer data.
        See Also:
        TransportBuffer

      • setGlobalFieldSetDefDb

        int setGlobalFieldSetDefDb(GlobalFieldSetDefDb setDefDb)
        Sets the Global Field Set Definition Database on the iterator. When used for encoding, the iterator will use that database to encode any field lists that contain set definitions.
        Parameters:
        setDefDb - - this is the database that will be used for encode.
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS if GlobalFieldSetDefDb is successfully set on the iterator.
        See Also:
        TransportBuffer

      • setGlobalElementSetDefDb

        int setGlobalElementSetDefDb(GlobalElementSetDefDb setDefDb)
        Sets the Global Element Set Definition Database on the iterator. When used for encoding, the iterator will use that database to encode any field lists that contain set definitions.
        Parameters:
        setDefDb - - this is the database that will be used for encode.
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS if GlobalFieldSetDefDb is successfully set on the iterator.
        See Also:
        TransportBuffer

      • realignBuffer

        int realignBuffer(Buffer newEncodeBuffer)
        Realigns Buffer's Iterator with buffer when new, larger buffer is needed to complete encoding. Typical use:
        1. Call realignBuffer() with the current iterator, and the new larger buffer to complete encoding into.
        2. Finish encoding using the new buffer and the same iterator you were using before.
        The user must pass in a newly allocated buffer, and the method does not deallocate the previous buffer.
        Parameters:
        newEncodeBuffer - The larger buffer to continue encoding into
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS if new iterator is successfully aligned with new buffer, CodecReturnCodes.FAILURE otherwise, typically due to new buffer not being sufficiently populated with buffer length or buffer data.
        See Also:
        Buffer

      • realignBuffer

        int realignBuffer(TransportBuffer newEncodeBuffer)
        Realigns Transport Buffer's Iterator with buffer when new, larger buffer is needed to complete encoding. Typical use:
        1. Call realignBuffer() with the current iterator, and the new larger buffer to complete encoding into.
        2. Finish encoding using the new buffer and the same iterator you were using before.
        The user must pass in a newly allocated buffer, and the method does not deallocate the previous buffer.
        Parameters:
        newEncodeBuffer - The larger buffer to continue encoding into
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS if new iterator is successfully aligned with new buffer, CodecReturnCodes.FAILURE otherwise, typically due to new buffer not being sufficiently populated with buffer length or buffer data.
        See Also:
        Buffer

      • encodeNonRWFInit

        int encodeNonRWFInit(Buffer buffer)
        Initialize encoding of non-RWF data into the encode iterator's buffer.
        Parameters:
        buffer - Buffer to encode into the iterator buffer
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS if new non-RWF Buffer is successfully encoded into iterator, non-success code from CodecReturnCodes otherwise
        See Also:
        Buffer

      • encodeNonRWFComplete

        int encodeNonRWFComplete(Buffer buffer,
                         boolean success)
        Complete encoding of non-RWF data into the encode iterator's buffer.
        Parameters:
        buffer - Buffer to encode into the iterator buffer
        success - If true - successfully complete the aggregate, if false - remove the aggregate from the buffer.
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS for successful completion, non-success code from CodecReturnCodes if not.
        See Also:
        Buffer

      • majorVersion

        int majorVersion()
        Major version number of the encode iterator. Valid only after setBufferAndRWFVersion(Buffer, int, int) call.
        Returns:
        Encode iterator major version when valid or CodecReturnCodes.FAILURE when invalid.

      • minorVersion

        int minorVersion()
        Minor version number of the encode iterator. Valid only after setBufferAndRWFVersion(Buffer, int, int) call.
        Returns:
        Encode iterator minor version when valid or CodecReturnCodes.FAILURE when invalid.

      • replaceStreamId

        int replaceStreamId(int streamId)
        Convenience method that replaces the streamId on an encoded UPA message.
        Parameters:
        streamId - the new stream id
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS, if the stream has been replaced, CodecReturnCodes.BUFFER_TOO_SMALL if the iterator buffer is too small

      • replaceSeqNum

        int replaceSeqNum(long seqNum)
        Convenience method that replaces the seqNum on an encoded UPA message. This only works if there is a seqNum already encoded in the message.
        Parameters:
        seqNum - the new sequence number
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS, if the seqNum has been replaced, CodecReturnCodes.BUFFER_TOO_SMALL if the iterator buffer is too small CodecReturnCodes.FAILURE if the encoded message does not have seqNum

      • replaceStreamState

        int replaceStreamState(int streamState)
        Convenience method that replaces the stream state on an encoded UPA message. This only works if there is a state already encoded in the message.
        Parameters:
        streamState - the new stream state
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS, if the streamState has been replaced, CodecReturnCodes.BUFFER_TOO_SMALL if the iterator buffer is too small CodecReturnCodes.FAILURE if the encoded message does not have state
        See Also:
        StreamStates

      • replaceDataState

        int replaceDataState(int dataState)
        Convenience method that replaces the data state on an encoded UPA message. This only works if there is a state already encoded in the message.
        Parameters:
        dataState - the new data state
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS, if the dataState has been replaced, CodecReturnCodes.BUFFER_TOO_SMALL if the iterator buffer is too small CodecReturnCodes.FAILURE if the encoded message does not have state
        See Also:
        DataStates

      • replaceStateCode

        int replaceStateCode(int stateCode)
        Convenience method that replaces the state code on an encoded UPA message. This only works if there is a state already encoded in the message.
        Parameters:
        stateCode - the state code
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS, if the code has been replaced, CodecReturnCodes.BUFFER_TOO_SMALL if the iterator buffer is too small CodecReturnCodes.FAILURE if the encoded message does not have state
        See Also:
        StateCodes

      • replaceGroupId

        int replaceGroupId(Buffer groupId)
        Convenience method that replaces the group id on an encoded UPA message. This only works if there is a group id already encoded in the message and the length of the new groupId is the same as the old one.
        Parameters:
        groupId - Buffer with groupID information
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS, if the groupId has been replaced, CodecReturnCodes.BUFFER_TOO_SMALL if the iterator buffer is too small CodecReturnCodes.FAILURE if the encoded message does not have state or the length of the new groupId is different than the encoded.
        See Also:
        Buffer

      • replacePostId

        int replacePostId(int postId)
        Convenience method that replaces an encoded post messages postId. This only works if there is a postId already encoded in the message.
        Parameters:
        postId - the post id
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS, if the postId has been replaced, CodecReturnCodes.BUFFER_TOO_SMALL if the iterator buffer is too small CodecReturnCodes.FAILURE if the encoded message does not have postId

      • setSolicitedFlag

        int setSolicitedFlag()
        Set the RefreshMsgFlags.SOLICITED flag on an encoded buffer.
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS, if the flag has been replaced, CodecReturnCodes.BUFFER_TOO_SMALL if the iterator buffer is too small or new flags would be different length
        See Also:
        RefreshMsgFlags

        See Also:
